200.description: Found some results for at least one address

post.summary: Geocode (postal address cleansing and conversion into geographical coordinates) all addresses in list
post.description: Fields available in output will depends upon parameter "mode" (see 'mode:xx' in response model)

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description:
Selection of fields in the ouput :

- coordinates: only return lat/long
- short: return lat/long, cleansed address (street, house number, postcode, postname, country)
- long: return all results from Nominatim

parameters.name: structuredOsm
parameters.description: if "true", will call the structured version of Nominatim/OSM

parameters.name: extraHouseNumber
parameters.description: if "true", will call libpostal on all addresses to get the house number

200.description: Found a match for this address (or some rejected addresses)

post.summary: Geocode (postal address cleansing and conversion into geographical coordinates) a single address
post.description: Fields available in output will depends upon parameter "mode" (see 'mode:xx' in response model)

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description:
Selection of columns in the ouput :

- coordinates: return mainly lat/long
- short: return lat/long, cleansed address (street, number, postcode, city, country)
- long: return all results from Nominatim

parameters.name: structuredOsm
parameters.description: If "true", will call the structured version of OSM

parameters.name: extraHouseNumber
parameters.description: If "true", will call libpostal on all addresses to get the house number (cf libpostalHouseNumber field in output bloc of output)

get.description:
Returns
-------
- {'status': 'DOWN'}: Nominatim server does not answer (or gives an unexpected answer)
- {'status': 'DEGRADED'}: Either Libpostal or Photon is down (or gives an unexpected answer). Geocoding is still possible as long as it does not requires one of those transformers
- {'status': 'UP'}: Service works correctly

info.title: NominatimWrapper API
info.description:
A service that allows geocoding (postal address cleansing and conversion into geographical coordinates), based on Nominatim (OpenStreetMap, OSM for short).

          Source available on: https://github.com/SmalsResearch/NominatimWrapper/

streetName.description: The name of a passage or way through from one location to another (cf. Fedvoc).

houseNumber.description: An official alphanumeric code assigned to building units, mooring places, stands or parcels (cf. Fedvoc)

postCode.description: The post code (a.k.a postal code, zip code etc.) (cf. Fedvoc)

postName.description: Name with which the geographical area that groups the addresses for postal purposes can be indicated, usually the city (cf. Fedvoc).

countryName.description: The country of the address, expressed in natural language, possibly with errors (cf. Fedvoc)

fullAddress.description: Full address in a single field. Cannot be used together with any of the other street component fields, with checkResult=true or with structuredOsm=true

match.description: A list with a single result

rejected.description: A list of rejected results (only if 'withRejected' is True)

output.description: Geocoding result (standardized address and geographical coordinates)

check.description: Similarity between input address and result (only if mode=long and checkResult=true). If checkResult=true, result are eliminated if (simPostCode = 0 and simCity < 0.5) or (simStreet < 0.5)

method.description: Which transformation methods were used before sending the address to Nominatim. If the address was found without any transformation, will be 'orig' (or 'fast') (mode:all)

placeRank.description: 'placeRank' field from Nominatim. 26: street level, 30: building level (mode:all)

rejectReason.description: 'mismatch' (only if checkResult is set to 'true') or 'tail' (only in 'rejected' bloc) (mode:all)

distanceToMatch.description: Distance (in kilometer) to the result given in 'match' (only in 'rejected' bloc) (mode:short,full)

transformedAddress.description: What address (after possibly some sequence of transformations) is actually sent to Nominatim (mode:full)

osmOrder.description: What was the rank of this result in Nominatim result (more useful in 'rejected' part) (mode:full)

matchOnCleansedHouseNumber.description: If placeRank in match record is below 30 and housenumber (in input) contains other characters than digits, we retry to call Nominatim by only considering the first digits of housenumber: '30A','30.3', '30 bt 2', '30-32' become '30'. If it gives a result with place_rank = 30, we keep it (in this case, a 'cleansedHouseNumber' appears in the output, with '30' in this example), and this field is set to 'True') (mode:full)

streetName.description: first non null value in ["road", "pedestrian","footway", "cycleway", "path", "address27", "construction", "hamlet", "park", "square"] from nominatim result. (mode:short,full)

postName.description: First non null value in ["town", "village", "city_district", "county", "city"] from nominatim result (mode:short,full)

displayName.example: 20, Avenue Fonsny - Fonsnylaan, Saint-Gilles - Sint-Gillis, Brussel-Hoofdstad - Bruxelles-Capitale, Région de Bruxelles-Capitale - Brussels Hoofdstedelijk Gewest, 1060, België / Belgique / Belgien

other.description: Concatenate all values which were not picked by one of the above item (mode:short,full). Not structured, not any guarantee about order.

libpostalHouseNumber.description: List of "housenumber" and "unit" provided by libpostal receiving concatenation of street and house number (from input) (if extraHouseNumber = true ; mode:short,full)

lat.description: Latitude, in EPSG:4326. Angular distance from some specified circle or plane of reference (mode:all)

lon.description: Longitude, in EPSG:4326. Angular distance measured on a great circle of reference from the intersection of the adopted zero meridian with this reference circle to the similar intersection of the meridian passing through the object (mode:all)

simStreetWhich.description: Which field in Nominatim was compared to input street name. Could be street_name (cf streetName output bloc), other (one element in other from output bloc), alt_names (name found in parent node), namedetails (usually a translation of the street name)

simStreet.description: Comparison score between input street name and the best item in the field given by simStreetWhich. Score is the maximum between Levenshtein distance (after removing common street name words in french/dutch, such as avenue, steenweg...) and an inclusion test (check that a string s1 is equal to another string s2, except that s2 contains an additional substring)

simCity.description: Levenshtein distances between in/out city names

simPostCode.description: Similarity between in/out postcode: 1 if both equal, 0.5 if two first digits are equal, 0 otherwise

simHouseNumber.description: Similarity between house numbers. 1 if perfect (non empty) match, 0.8 on range match (10 vs 8-10 or 10-12), 0.5 on number match (10A vs 10)

rejected.description: A list of rejected results (only if 'withRejected' is True)

ParseError.description: When a mask can't be parsed

MaskError.description: When any error occurs on mask
